remarks.para: The method starts a user interface for selecting a color value.

The class is not intended for use outside of the design time environment. requires the , which is typically available within a Web Forms project at design time. If you want to build HTML color strings, you may want to implement a method that converts the RGB values of a object to an HTML-compatible RRGGBB format string. If you intend to use a control to select a color or configure a color, you can build a user interface for this, or you may want to use a control which allows you to edit properties with the default providing a color selection interface.

summary.para: Provides an HTML color string builder at design time that allows a user to select a color.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string BuildColor (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.Windows.Forms.Control owner, string initialColor);

remarks.para: The returned string, if other than null, indicates a color in a valid HTML color format. Valid formats include named colors and color codes in RGB format (#RRGGBB).

summary.para: Starts a color editor to build an HTML color property value.

returns.para: The color value, represented as a string in an HTML color format, or null if the builder service could not be retrieved.
